question_sentence: A scathing review by The Spectator of Liz Truss's newly published memoir compared the short-lived PM to which comedy character?
evidence: Liz Truss is reportedly hoping her memoir-cum-manifesto, "Ten Years to Save the West", will kickstart her attempt at a political comeback. But reviewers have been unimpressed by her book, which is "as readable as a crisp packet", said The Times' senior political correspondent Patrick Maguire.

question_sentence: Which US college basketball player was the top pick in Monday's WNBA Draft?
evidence: The University of Iowa basketball superstar and NCAA Division I all-time leading scorer was picked first in this week's WNBA draft, by the Indiana Fever. The Los Angeles Sparks chose Stanford's Cameron Brink second, and South Carolina's Kamilla Cardoso was the No. 3 pick, for the Chicago Sky.

question_sentence: The Post Office software system that predated Horizon and is now also under scrutiny is called what?
evidence: An independent IT expert will investigate claims that Capture contained similar glitches to Horizon that may also have led to the wrongful convictions of former sub-masters for financial misconduct. Dozens of former sub-postmasters claim they suffered unexplained shortfalls while using Capture, a predecessor to Horizon that was rolled out in 1992.

question_sentence: Which US university faced criticism for cancelling a pro-Palestinian valedictorian's speech?
evidence: The university announced on Monday that valedictorian Asna Tabassum's planned graduation speech had been cancelled, owing to "substantial risks relating to security and disruption". Tabassum, who is Muslim, said USC had "caved into a campaign of hatred" by critics who complained about her pro-Palestinian social media posts.

question_sentence: New safety measures at Saturday'sGrand Nationalincluded reducing the permitted number of runners from 40 to how many?
evidence: The permitted number of runners was reduced as part of a raft of new safety measures, but in the event, only 32 horses ran, following last-minute withdrawals. Other precautions introduced at the 2024 Grand National to reduce the risk of horse fatalities include a standing start and a shorter distance to the first fence.

question_sentence: An Oklahoma family who bought a pet without realising it was pregnant are now the owners of 51 what?
evidence: The family thought the pregnant mollusc was a male when they bought it as a ninth birthday gift for their octopus-obsessed son. For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to The Week'sTall Talesnewsletter.

question_sentence: What industry that was once "the glue holding middle-class families together" is on the brink of collapse, according to The Sunday Times?
evidence: The British Au Pair Agencies Association has shut its doors, citing the lack of clear legal routes for UK families to employ au pairs following Brexit. And the government's announcement earlier this month that live-in workers are now entitled to earn at least the minimum wage could be the death knell of the tradition of exchanging bed and board for childcare.

question_sentence: Which weather event triggered flight cancellations and school closures in Dubai this week?
evidence: Dubai was hit with a year-and-a-half’s worth of rain in a single day, resulting in widespread flooding. Much of the UAE was brought to a standstill by the record-breaking rainfall.

question_sentence: The market for the milk of which mammal has climbed to $7.5 billion a year, according to latest data?
evidence: The alternative to cow, sheep and goat milk has long beenpopular across the Middle East and Africa,and demand is now growing in the West too among consumers drawn by its nutritional profile and allergy-friendliness. Academics are predicting that the global camel dairy industry could be worth $13 billion by the end of the decade.

question_sentence: US Republican House speaker Mike Johnson risked his job this week by advocating for what?
evidence: Despite the objections of Republican hardliners, Johnson has decided to advocate for Ukraine aid and scheduled a vote on Saturday.

question_sentence: The flame for the 2024 Olympics was lit this week. Where did the ceremony occur?
evidence: The flame was lit in Olympia, Greece — the birthplace of the ancient Olympics. The torch will now begin its journey in a relay to light the cauldron that will mark the opening of the Paris Summer Games in July.

question_sentence: Which extreme weather event disrupted airport operations in Dubai?
evidence: Dubai was inundated this week with its heaviest rainfall in 75 years. Shocking video shows roads turned to rivers and the tarmac of Dubai International Airport underwater.

question_sentence: Where is former President Donald Trump facing his first criminal trial?
evidence: Donald Trump made history this week when he arrived in Manhattan as the first former president to go on trial for criminal charges. A panel of 12 New Yorkers and likely six alternates will ultimately be chosen.

question_sentence: Which automaker announced it will cut around 14,000 jobs?
evidence: Tesla is set to cut more than 10% of its global staff of 140,000, CEO Elon Musk wrote in an email to company employees. Musk attributed the planned job cuts to the need for “cost reductions and increasing productivity,” according to reports.

question_sentence: Which city is constructing "the world's largest wildlife crossing" over a busy freeway?
evidence: A crossing in Los Angeles will provide a safe passage for wildlife — including mountain lions, coyotes, deer, snakes, and even ants.

question_sentence: Which professional sports league unveiled their 2024 draft class this week?
evidence: The WNBA draft took place this week as excitement builds around women’s basketball. Several elite female athletes announced they’re taking their talents to the league, including Caitlin Clark who was selected No. 1 overall by the Indiana Fever.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden and first lady Dr. Jill Biden released their joint tax return this week. Around how much did the Bidens earn in 2023?
evidence: The Bidens made almost $620,000 in 2023, according to their joint tax return released by the White House on Monday — the deadline for most Americans to file their taxes.

question_sentence: Which landmark was engulfed in a massive fire this week?
evidence: A massive fire destroyed Denmark's old stock exchange. “It is a huge disaster, because it is 400 years of cultural history that is in flames,” said Brian Mikkelsen, CEO of the Danish Chamber of Commerce.

question_sentence: Which university’s president was grilled on Capitol Hill this week over antisemitism on campus?
evidence: Columbia University President Nemat Shafik testified before a House committee this week over the university's response to antisemitism. Four months ago, testimonies by Harvard's Claudine Gay and University of Pennsylvania's Elizabeth Magill eventually led to a chain of events that ended with the two leaders stepping down from their positions.

question_sentence: Which populous city banned the construction of new hotels as a way to fight overtourism?
evidence: Amsterdam will no longer allow new hotel buildings to be built in an aim to fight against mass tourism, the local government announced this week.

question_sentence: On April 13, a fireball was spotted in the sky. How many states reported sightings of this fireball?
What was the significant change in the crime rate at the University of Delaware from 2019 to 2022?
choices: The crime rate more than doubled

question_sentence: What was the field of study for David Roselle’s doctorate degree?
Who is set to be the first director of the new Department of Public Safety in Sussex County, Delaware?
What is the purpose of the $15 million grant received for the Taylor’s Bridge Road raising plan in Delaware?
choices: To build a new shopping mall
To replace Taylor’s Bridge over Blackbird Creek and raise the road on both sides leading up to the bridge
To construct a new sports stadium

question_sentence: What action did the Westminster Civic Association take in April 2023 that sparked controversy among the homeowners?
choices: They put out a survey asking if RVs and boats are aesthetically pleasing for the community
They changed the bylaws without holding a proper vote.

question_sentence: What special offer is Jimmy John’s providing for the 420 celebration?
choices: A free sandwich for every customer
The Deliciously Dope Dime Bag meal for $10
A buy one get one free offer on all sandwiches

question_sentence: Who is the screenwriter behind the remake of the 1991 cult dark comedy “Don’t Tell Mom the Babysitter’s Dead”?
Who is the former Saint Mark’s High and Delaware State University standout who reached the major leagues and heads the seven 2024 inductees to the Delaware Baseball Hall of Fame?
What is one of the proposed regulations for short-term rentals in Wilmington, as outlined in the ordinance sponsored by Councilperson Bregetta Fields and co-sponsored by Councilperson Nathan Field?
choices: Making short-term rental units the primary use for the property.
Prohibiting contact information for the rental owner from being shared with guests.
Limiting the occupancy in short-term rental units.
